text: Psalm 52
God’s Judgment on the Wicked and Love for the Faithful
For the \add music\add* director. A maskil of David.
When Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul.

And he said to him, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”\f + \fr Ps 52 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first two verses of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by two \f*
Why do you boast about evil, O mighty man?
The loyal love of God \add endures\add* ⸤continually⸥.\f + \fr 52:1 \ft Literally “all the day” \f*
Your tongue plans destruction,
like a sharp razor, working deceit.
You love evil more than good,
a lie more than speaking ⸤what is right⸥.\f + \fr 52:3 \ft Literally “righteousness” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
You love all devouring words,
O deceitful tongue,
but God will pull you down forever.
He will snatch you and tear you away from \add your\add* tent,
and \add he\add* will uproot you from \add the\add* land of \add the\add* living. \qs Selah\qs*
And \add the\add* righteous will see and fear,
and will laugh at him, \add saying\add*,
“Look, the man \add who\add* would not make God his refuge,
but he trusted in the greatness of his wealth;
he took refuge in his destructiveness.”
But I \add am\add* like an olive tree flourishing
in the house\f + \fr 52:8 \ft Or “temple” \f* of God.
I trust the loyal love of God forever and ever.
I will give thanks to you forever, because \add of what\add* you have done,
and I will wait on your name, because \add it is\add* good,
in the presence of your faithful ones.
